Description: Fragment from the side of a glazed composition pilgrim-bottle of the type of the New Year's flasks; traces of a blue glaze floral decoration on the raised band, which originally passed around the perimeter of the rounded vessel. The glazed composition has suffered decay; it is eroded on the interior and has turned white and chalky.
Curator's comments: One of the "many varieties of 'pilgrim bottles' of green or yellow paste, with necks of lotus and palm patterns, some very graceful, and wreathed around the body with very varied patterns" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72. See also London, BM, EA 21779, 21780, 21781, 21782, 23755, 23756, 23757, 55345, Bolton, 1886.28.23.a and b and Boston, MFA, RES.87.146.a-h.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 75 § 72)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.53, p.174, pl.16)
